quiz.title: Articles (a/an/the) - A1 Level
quiz.description: Master indefinite articles (a/an), definite article (the), and zero article usage at A1 level.

questions.explanation: Use 'a' before consonant sounds. 'Cat' starts with /k/ sound.
Use 'an' before vowel sounds. 'Engineer' starts with /e/ sound.
Use 'the' with unique things. There is only one sun.
Use 'an' before vowel sounds. 'Umbrella' starts with /ʌ/ sound.

questions.prompt: There is ____ book on the table.
questions.explanation: Use 'a' when mentioning something for the first time. 'Book' starts with /b/ sound.
questions.hint: Is this the first time we mention the book?

questions.prompt: ____ book on the table is mine.
questions.explanation: Use 'the' when referring to something specific that was mentioned before.
questions.hint: Which book are we talking about?

questions.explanation: Use 'an' before vowel sounds. 'Honest' starts with /ɒ/ sound (h is silent).
Don't use articles with uncountable nouns in general statements.
Use 'an' before vowel sounds. 'Office' starts with /ɒ/ sound.
Use 'the' with unique things. There is only one moon.
questions.hint: How many moons does Earth have?

questions.explanation: Use 'an' before vowel sounds. 'Apple' starts with /æ/ sound.
Use 'a' before consonant sounds. 'House' starts with /h/ sound.
Don't use articles with uncountable nouns in general statements.
questions.hint: Is 'chocolate' countable or uncountable in general?

questions.prompt: There is ____ university in our city.
questions.explanation: Use 'a' before consonant sounds. 'University' starts with /j/ sound (you-niversity).
questions.hint: How do you pronounce the first sound of 'university'?

questions.explanation: Use 'the' with unique things like planets.
Use 'an' before vowel sounds. 'Orange' starts with /ɒ/ sound.

questions.prompt: I go to ____ school every day.
questions.explanation: Don't use articles with 'school' when talking about the activity of studying.
questions.hint: Are we talking about a building or an activity?

questions.explanation: Use 'a' before consonant sounds. 'Teacher' starts with /t/ sound.
Don't use articles with uncountable nouns in general statements.
questions.hint: Is this a general statement about water?

questions.prompt: I saw ____ elephant at the zoo.
questions.explanation: Use 'an' before vowel sounds. 'Elephant' starts with /e/ sound.

questions.prompt: ____ elephant I saw was very big.
questions.explanation: Use 'the' when referring to something specific that was mentioned before.
questions.hint: Which elephant are we talking about?

questions.explanation: Use 'a' before consonant sounds. 'Nurse' starts with /n/ sound.
Don't use articles with uncountable nouns in general statements.
questions.hint: Is this a general statement about coffee?

questions.explanation: Use 'an' before vowel sounds. 'Hour' starts with /aʊ/ sound (h is silent).

questions.prompt: ____ President lives in the White House.
questions.explanation: Use 'the' with unique positions or titles.
questions.hint: How many Presidents are there at one time?

questions.explanation: Use 'a' before consonant sounds. 'Pen' starts with /p/ sound.
Use 'the' with musical instruments.
questions.hint: What article do we use with musical instruments?

questions.explanation: Don't use articles with meals in general statements.
questions.hint: Do we use articles with meal names?

questions.explanation: Use 'an' before vowel sounds. 'Expensive' starts with /ɪ/ sound.
Use 'the' when referring to something specific that was mentioned before.
questions.hint: Which car are we talking about?

questions.prompt: I go to ____ bed at 10 PM.
questions.explanation: Don't use articles with 'bed' when talking about sleeping.
questions.hint: Are we talking about furniture or an activity?

questions.explanation: Use 'an' before vowel sounds. 'Excellent' starts with /e/ sound.
Don't use articles with plural nouns in general statements.
questions.hint: Is this a general statement about all dogs?

questions.prompt: There is ____ interesting movie on TV.
questions.explanation: Use 'an' before vowel sounds. 'Interesting' starts with /ɪ/ sound.

questions.prompt: ____ movie on TV is very funny.
questions.explanation: Use 'the' when referring to something specific that was mentioned before.
questions.hint: Which movie are we talking about?

questions.explanation: Use 'a' before consonant sounds. 'Hospital' starts with /h/ sound.
Don't use articles with language names.
questions.hint: Do we use articles with language names?

questions.explanation: Use 'a' before consonant sounds. 'Beautiful' starts with /b/ sound.
Use 'the' with names of oceans, seas, and rivers.
questions.hint: What article do we use with ocean names?

questions.explanation: Use 'a' before consonant sounds. 'Doctor' starts with /d/ sound.
Don't use articles with meals in general statements.
questions.hint: Do we use articles with meal names?

questions.prompt: There is ____ old man in the park.
questions.explanation: Use 'an' before vowel sounds. 'Old' starts with /oʊ/ sound.

questions.prompt: ____ old man in the park is feeding birds.
questions.explanation: Use 'the' when referring to something specific that was mentioned before.
questions.hint: Which old man are we talking about?

questions.explanation: Don't use articles with sports names.
questions.hint: Do we use articles with sport names?

questions.explanation: Use 'the' with country names that include words like 'United', 'Republic', etc.
questions.hint: What article do we use with 'United States'?
